summary: The document is an interview transcript with Gary Edward Taylor, a taxi cab driver, conducted by the House Select Committee on Assassinations (HSCA) on June 11, 1978. Taylor shared his recollections of Lee Harvey Oswald (LHO) from their interactions in the early 1960s, describing Oswald as unsociable, superficial, and not well-liked. He mentioned Oswald's time in Russia, his lack of social graces, and minimal discussions about his life there. Taylor also noted Oswald's interest in writing, his possession of a rifle, and Marina Oswald's apparent fear of him. Additionally, Taylor speculated on George De Mohrenschildt's unusual interest in Oswald and hinted at a possible confession among De Mohrenschildt's papers.
key_findings: Gary Taylor described Lee Harvey Oswald as unsociable and superficial.
Oswald discussed his time in Russia only in general terms and seemed dissatisfied with his life there.
Taylor noted Oswald's interest in writing and his possession of a manuscript.
Marina Oswald showed Taylor a rifle belonging to Lee and appeared to fear him.
Taylor questioned George De Mohrenschildt's unusual interest in Oswald and mentioned a possible confession in De Mohrenschildt's papers.
